Entries.default: "Stop right there. The powderhouse is closed except to officers of the Royal Deadfire Company." She looks you up and down, vexed and suspicious.
"You there!" The guard sees you and strides over, purpose quickening her step.
"Defend the powderhouse!"
"Hold your positions, everyone! There's trouble."
"Everyone out!"
"After all I've done, you still don't trust me enough to let me look around?"
[Leave] "Sorry, I'll go."
[Lie] "I'm inspecting this place for the hazanui. Didn't you get the message?"
[Attack] "No one stands in my way!"
"What's this?"
"I'm not falling for that. Not with your reputation." She narrows her eyes.
"Fine. But no open flames in here, understand? "And don't go downstairs." She gives you a final sharp look before returning to her duties.
"I'll escort you out."
"Fine. But no open flames in here, understand? "And don't go downstairs." She gives you a final sharp look before returning to her duties.
"What are you doing here?"
"Feel free to look around up here, but stay out of the basement storage."
"I don't know what you're up to, but this is your last warning." She scowls.
"Careful around the powder. And don't go downstairs."
"If I catch you in here again, there's going to be trouble."
"I warned you!"
"He's fixing to blow it up. Check him for explosives." Maia steps back and folds her arms.
Entries.female: "She's fixing to blow it up. Check her for explosives." Maia steps back and folds her arms.

Entries.default: "Maia!"
[Attack] "This got off to a fine start."
The guards advance and draw their weapons, teeth clenched with steely resolve.

"Sorry, captain. There's bigger concerns in this archipelago than a broken castle and your wounded pride."

She signals to the other soldiers.
